key_dependencies: Google Cloud Vision API (food image recognition - Phase 2)
KFDA API (Korean Food & Drug Administration - nutrition data)
USDA FoodData Central API (international food data)

target_audience.primary_persona: Korean health-conscious individuals aged 20-45 who want to systematically track body composition, diet, exercise, and sleep
secondary_personas: Fitness enthusiasts tracking body composition changes
Health-conscious individuals wanting AI-powered dietary feedback
pain_points: Difficulty tracking body composition changes over time
No integrated solution for diet + exercise + sleep tracking
Existing apps don't support Korean food database well
Manual calorie counting is tedious and error-prone
Hard to visualize progress toward health goals
goals: Track and visualize body composition changes (weight, body fat %, muscle mass)
Log and analyze daily diet with AI feedback
Set and achieve health goals (weight loss/gain, muscle building)
target_audience.usage_context: Daily health tracking app used primarily on iPhone for logging meals, workouts, sleep, and body measurements

product_vision.one_liner: AI-powered personal health management agent that integrates body composition, diet, exercise, and sleep tracking
product_vision.problem_statement: Health-conscious individuals struggle to comprehensively track and understand the relationship between their body composition, diet, exercise, and sleep patterns, especially with Korean food databases and personalized AI insights
product_vision.value_proposition: Bodii provides an integrated health tracking solution with Korean food database support (KFDA), AI-powered diet analysis using Gemini, accurate BMR/TDEE calculations based on body composition, and comprehensive visualization of health metrics
success_metrics: Daily active users recording all four metrics (body/diet/exercise/sleep)

existing_features: Core Data model with all entities (User, BodyRecord, MetabolismSnapshot, Food, FoodRecord, ExerciseRecord, SleepRecord, DailyLog, Goal)
known_gaps: Body composition input/history/graph screens not implemented
Food search and recording UI not implemented
API integrations (KFDA, USDA, Gemini) not implemented
Sleep tracking UI and popup not implemented
technical_debt: Only basic project structure exists - most services and ViewModels need to be created
API key management system not set up

alternatives: MyFitnessPal - comprehensive calorie tracking but weak on Korean foods
Samsung Health - good integration but Android-focused
Apple Health - data hub but lacks food logging
Noom - psychology-focused weight loss but expensive subscription
differentiators: AI-powered diet analysis with Korean language support (Gemini)
Integrated body composition + diet + exercise + sleep tracking
Accurate BMR/TDEE calculations using Katch-McArdle and Mifflin-St Jeor formulas
Data-driven approach with comprehensive metric storage strategy
Free tier API usage to minimize costs
competitive_context.market_position: iOS-first health tracking app optimized for Korean users with AI-powered dietary insights and comprehensive body composition tracking
competitor_pain_points: Existing apps have poor Korean food database coverage
Many apps require paid subscriptions for basic features
Lack of integrated body composition tracking with diet analysis
No AI-powered dietary feedback in Korean language

technical: API rate limits: Gemini 15 RPM, Cloud Vision 1000/month free tier
resources: Solo developer project (inferred from git history)
Free API tiers only for Phase 1-2
Server costs deferred to Phase 3 (social features)
dependencies: KFDA Open API (Korean food nutrition data)
Google Cloud Vision API (food image recognition - Phase 2)
